justification: “Judging verifiability, participants were asked to evaluate ‘How verifiable is this statement?’, on a scale from ‘totally unverifiable’ (-100) to ‘totally verifiable’ (+100).”
“Judging deception, participants were asked to evaluate ‘How truthful is this statement?’, on a scale from ‘totally deceitful’ (-100) to ‘totally truthful’ (+100).”

Participants made “snap judgements based on either verifiability or detailedness,” and the instructions for these judgements “were the same as for Studies 1 to 3,” implying the same −100 to +100 rating format.

measured_by: content coding: count of verifiable details by trained coders
justification: “Content-coding by trained coders showed that the 32 truthful statements … contained more verifiable details than the 32 deceptive statements.”

measured_by: content coding: count of perceptual, temporal and spatial details by trained coders
justification: “Coders counted the number of perceptual, temporal, and spatial details, and we summed these to provide an index of richness in detail.”
